header.title: The best fence installation company in Yuba City
bullets: Create, review and edit your FREE quote online using our custom tool.
Ask questions to our friendly, responsive team.
Understand what’s included with your project with our transparent quotes and pricing.
Enjoy your new fence built by our team of skilled local craftsmen.

Yelp.description: I had an excellent experience with Ergeon. Communication was easy, clear and quick. I loved the ability to text with my project manager and the speed they were able to make things happen was just what I needed. My project turned out beautiful and will go back to them for future projects I have. Highly recommend.
Yelp.name: Ryan W.
Yelp.title: I had an excellent experience with Ergeon.

Google.description: We had Eregon replace our fence in Yuba City. We have a larger yard and after collecting several quotes eregon was the best price. On top of that their estimate and quote process was the easiest and most professional. We have small kiddos and small dogs so we were concerned about the time to replace the fence. Eregon's crew had the old fence down and the new one up in only 2 days! Every member of the crew was friendly and professional, and our fence looks beautiful. Thank you Eregon!
Google.name: Jen T.
Google.title: Every member of the crew was friendly and professional, and our fence looks beautiful.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
